Properties.Name: Text
Properties.Value:
This Workflow synchronizes customers from HubSpot CRM to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales. 
It begins by retrieving customer records from HubSpot, then splits and processes each record individually. For each customer, the Workflow checks if it has already been processed. If so, a message is displayed using the Formatter. 
If not, it builds the source payload, maps the data into the required Dynamics 365 format, and creates the customer in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales. 
The outcome—success or error—is then logged using key-value records.

Nodes.Name: VariableBar
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are setting the Group for Key Values

Nodes.Name: Formatter
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we display a message if the Customer ID has been found in the Key Values

Properties.Name: Expression
Properties.Value: Customer ID: "{CustomerID}" has already been processed.

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are logging the Key Value record for successful records.
We get the Group from the Variable bar.
We use the Customer ID as the Key (Notice the fx on the input - you need to select which field in the payload is the Key.)
We use the MS Dynamics 365 Sales Response Id as the Value.

Nodes.Name: HubSpotCrm
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are retrieving a list of HubSpot Customers limited to 10 for this sample Workflow

Properties.Description: Read a page of contacts. Control what is returned via the `properties` query param.
Properties.Name: Name

Properties.Description: The maximum number of results to display per page.
Properties.Name: limit

Nodes.Name: ForEach
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we split the full Customer List from HubSpot into individual customer records

Nodes.Name: GetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we check to see if the Customer ID has been processed before by checking if a Key Value record has already been logged for this Customer ID.

Nodes.Name: Formatter
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are building the Source Payload for the QuickMap by wrapping the Item Payload from the For Each Node

Nodes.Name: QuickMap
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we map the customer data retrieved from HubSpot to the MS Dynamics 365 Sales format before creating the customer record.
Both JSON and XML document types are utilized in this step.

Nodes.Name: MicrosoftDynamicsCrm
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are creating the Customer record in MS Dynamics 365 Sales

Properties.Name: RequestXml

Properties.Schema:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="Response">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="contact">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="status" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="id" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="error" type="xs:string" />
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>
Properties.Name: ResponseXml

Nodes.Name: IfVisualBasic
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are checking if the Customer was created successfully in MS Dynamics 365 Sales by filtering on the status field.

A successful MS Dynamics 365 Sales Response contains a status of true:
<Response>
  <result>
    <status>success</status>
    <function>create</function>
    <controlid>638859300410961774</controlid>
    <data listtype="objects" count="1">
      <customer>
        <RECORDNO>1629</RECORDNO>
        <CUSTOMERID>9037440024123</CUSTOMERID>
      </customer>
    </data>
  </result>
</Response>

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are logging the Key Value record for error records.
We get the Group from the Variable bar.
We use the Customer ID as the Key (Notice the fx on the input - you need to select which field in the payload is the Key.)
We use the MS Dynamics 365 Sales Response error as the Value.

Name: HubSpot To Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales Customers
Description: This Workflow syncs customers from HubSpot to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, processing each record individually. It checks for prior processing, maps new records, creates them in Dynamics 365, and logs the outcome.
